tasks.task: Farming blackberries for millions of pounds

subtasks: Choosing a location with well-draining soil, full sunlight, wind protection, and slightly acidic to neutral pH.
Conducting soil tests to determine pH and nutrient levels.
Amending soil with lime or other materials as needed.
Improving soil structure and fertility for planting.
Preparing the soil for planting blackberry bushes.
Regularly watering the plants to ensure adequate moisture.
Applying fertilizers to promote plant growth (fertilization schedule.)
Pruning canes to maintain plant health and structure.
Monitoring the plants for pests and diseases.
Implementing Integrated Pest Management (IPM) techniques, such as introducing beneficial insects or using organic treatments.
Identifying ripe blackberries (ripeness indicators like color changes.)
Collecting berries into appropriate containers.
Sorting and grading the harvested blackberries for quality.
Transporting the harvested blackberries to a packing facility.
Cleaning the blackberries if necessary.
Packing the berries into boxes or other containers suitable for distribution.
Refrigerating the packaged blackberries to maintain freshness and quality.
Ensuring proper temperature and humidity levels during storage.
